header.title: Guidelines for Contributors - Australian Journal of Parapsychology

central_thesis: The Australian Journal of Parapsychology provides clear instructions for authors to submit theoretical or experimental papers on paranormal topics, ensuring submissions adhere to the journal's scope, formatting standards (APA style, Australian spelling), and peer-review process, while remaining accessible to an intelligent layperson audience.

structure_content.summary: The journal welcomes theoretical or experimental papers related to the paranormal, including extra-sensory perception, psychokinesis, and life after death. It explicitly states it is not a 'New Age' or religious journal, aims to be accessible to intelligent laypersons, and typically includes at least one technical article per issue.

Contributors are required to follow the journal's style and format, which is based on the American Psychological Association (APA) style. All theoretical or experimental papers must include an abstract and a reference section. Australian spelling is preferred over American spelling.
All submissions to the journal, with the exception of book reviews and correspondence, undergo a peer-review process to ensure quality and relevance.

Further details can be found on the journal's website (www.aiprinc.org/journal.asp). Contributions can be submitted electronically as email attachments to lance.storm@adelaide.edu.au or via postal mail to Dr. Lance Storm at the School of Psychology, University of Adelaide, Adelaide SA 5005, AUSTRALIA.

practical_system.description: This document outlines a submission system for academic articles, detailing the steps and requirements for authors to successfully contribute to the Australian Journal of Parapsychology. It specifies the subject matter, formatting rules (APA style, Australian spelling), and the peer-review process, along with contact methods for submission.

relevant_quotes.text: The Australian Journal of Parapsychology welcomes theoretical or experimental papers on all topics to do with the paranormal, including extra-sensory perception, psychokinesis, and life after death.
Note, however, that we are not a 'New Age' or religious journal.

To make the editorial task easier we ask that contributors submit articles in the style and format exemplified in this journal, which follows the style authorised by the American Psychological Association (APA).
All submissions, other than book reviews and correspondence, are peer-reviewed.

critical_analysis.relevance: This document is highly relevant for individuals, particularly academic researchers and scholars, who are interested in publishing their work within the field of parapsychology. It serves as a foundational guide for understanding the specific requirements, editorial stance, and submission protocols of the Australian Journal of Parapsychology, ensuring submissions are aligned with the journal's academic standards and thematic focus.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of academic contributors, researchers, and practitioners in parapsychology and related disciplines who wish to submit theoretical or experimental papers for publication. A secondary audience includes students and others who need to understand the guidelines for academic publishing in this specialized field.
